techStack.name: JavaScript
techStack.description: JavaScript is my primary programming language. I've used it extensively for both frontend and backend development, building everything from simple websites to complex SPAs and APIs.

techStack.name: TypeScript
techStack.description: TypeScript has become my go-to for all new projects. I appreciate the type safety and improved developer experience it provides over vanilla JavaScript.

techStack.name: React
techStack.description: React is my preferred frontend library. I've built numerous applications with it, from small components to large-scale applications with complex state management.

techStack.name: Next.js
techStack.description: Next.js is my framework of choice for React applications. I love its built-in routing, SSR capabilities, and overall developer experience.

techStack.name: Node.js
techStack.description: Node.js is my primary backend runtime. I've built RESTful APIs, microservices, and server-rendered applications with it.

techStack.name: Express
techStack.description: Express is my go-to framework for building Node.js APIs. I've used it to create everything from simple REST endpoints to complex API architectures.

techStack.name: MongoDB
techStack.description: MongoDB is my preferred NoSQL database. I've used it extensively with Node.js applications, leveraging its flexible schema design for various use cases.

techStack.name: PostgreSQL
techStack.description: PostgreSQL is my relational database of choice. I've used it for projects requiring complex queries, transactions, and data integrity.

techStack.name: GraphQL
techStack.description: I've implemented GraphQL APIs with Apollo Server and consumed them with Apollo Client. I appreciate its flexibility for frontend data fetching.

techStack.name: Redux
techStack.description: I've used Redux for state management in large React applications. While I now often prefer simpler alternatives, I'm very comfortable with Redux patterns.

techStack.name: Tailwind CSS
techStack.description: Tailwind CSS has become my preferred styling solution. I love its utility-first approach and the speed at which I can build responsive interfaces with it.

techStack.name: Sass
techStack.description: Before Tailwind, Sass was my go-to CSS preprocessor. I've used it to create maintainable stylesheets with variables, mixins, and nested rules.

techStack.name: Git
techStack.description: Git is essential to my workflow. I'm comfortable with branching strategies, resolving conflicts, rebasing, and other advanced Git operations.

techStack.name: Jest
techStack.description: Jest is my primary testing framework. I write unit and integration tests for both frontend and backend code to ensure reliability.

techStack.name: Webpack
techStack.description: I've configured Webpack for various projects, setting up optimized builds, code splitting, and asset management.

techStack.name: Firebase
techStack.description: I've used Firebase for authentication, real-time databases, and hosting in several projects. It's my go-to for rapid prototyping.

techStack.name: AWS
techStack.description: I've worked with various AWS services including S3, EC2, Lambda, and DynamoDB to build scalable cloud applications.

techStack.name: Vercel
techStack.description: Vercel is my preferred deployment platform for frontend applications. I love its seamless integration with Git and Next.js.

techStack.name: Figma
techStack.description: I use Figma for UI design and prototyping. As a developer with design skills, I can translate designs into code accurately.

techStack.name: HTML
techStack.description: HTML is fundamental to my work. I write semantic, accessible markup and stay current with HTML5 features and best practices.

techStack.name: CSS
techStack.description: I have strong CSS skills, including flexbox, grid, animations, and responsive design. I can implement complex layouts with clean, maintainable code.
